column4: Hello. I have MP3 player. It is detected everywehere, except one computer. I have investigated that the player there is being detected as USB1.1 device. Please help.
How old is the machine... Both the device and the mobo both have to support USB 2.0 etc for it to work.
It might just be that the PC in question is too old to understand anything other that USB 1.1
The mobo is GigaByte N650SLI-DS4 - NVidia 650i chipset. OS is lucid.
The computer is working well with USB 2.0 flash
OK... So the board is USB 2 capable.
sure
Does the MP3 player detect as USB 2 in the other machines?
Yes, It works well on my second computer. The same OS, but other mobo.
I have a sneaking suspicion this might be a hardware issue, though exactly what, I'm not sure.
What you could try doing is install another OS on this mobo and see if it detects it as USB 2. See whether it's down to the OS or the hardware.
thanks.
One note: the player was detected there only once.
Only once on which mobo... The Gigabyte in question or another?
I have seen the player detected once on that gigabyte computer. And other USB2 devices: camera, flash, cellphone works well
Strange... Way strange. What changed since the MP3 player was detected sucessfully.
nothing has changed.
I'm having suspicions it may be a clash somewhere...
Maybe it's drawing too much power or something... A possibility.
Try fully charging it first, then connecting it up, if it detects it then, power is a possibility. Either that or connect it through a powered USB 2 hub.
Either way, try and reduce the load on the USB.
I do not have powered USB hub. But I like your idea about charging, thanks
No probs...
